title: How much more bomb loads can modern bombers deliver in comparison to WWII bombers? - Quora

response.answer_text: B-17 American heavy bomber of WWII: 8,000 pounds maximum. B-29 even heavier American bomber of WWII: 20,000 pounds maximum. Contemporary B-52 heavy American bomber: 70,000 pounds maximum. Contemporary Tu-160 supersonic heavy Russian bomber: 99,000 pounds maximum. Contemporary newer B-2 supersonic heavy American bomber: 50,000 pounds maximum. F-15 contemporary American multi-role fighter jet: 16,000 pounds on hard points. F-35 contemporary newer American multi-role fighter jet: 18,000 pounds total including hard points. As you can see, contemporary fighter planes carry the same bomb load as WWII heavy bombers. Even more importantly, if a contemporary bomb is dropped, it will hit its target most of the time, far more than could be said of any WWII bomb.
They don’t really use “More” they used “Better”. We really don’t use bombers like we use to… Ships and artillery can create havoc from afar and he have a thing called missiles now…
